main event: A large, round, white object was observed for 3 seconds at Fairchild AFB, Washington on December 3, 1957.
interesting points: The object disappeared in a flash.
The sighting occurred during a meteoritic shower called the Geminids.
The object was initially thought to be a balloon, astronomical object, or aircraft, but there was insufficient data for a definitive evaluation.
The object was observed by ground-visual means and was described as making a starboard turn in an aircraft.
The pilot of a B-52 aircraft at 43,020 feet altitude also reported observing the object.
